page.title: 12 I INTERVIEWED GRANDMA
page.content: My Grandma remembered that she liked school and that there was a smell of chalk dust. They used nylon stockings which lasted a long time. They had parachute silk underwear in the war. She said that cars often broke down. They had running boards which you had to step on to get in the car. They also had little flaps in the roof. She had an Armstrong. In the Drapers they had a high desk at the back and you put your money in a basket on a wire and the person at the other end would put your change in the basket and send it back to you. They did not have any super-markets. They used to have lots more little shops and some dairies. They had radios but no television. They played hop-scotch, ball games and did lots of handstands.
